attributes.comment:
I am against any fee increase regardless of efficiency or inefficiency. My
impression of USCIS operations was in 2004. My wife had her green card
interview at the district office in Charlotte, NC. While talking to the interviewing
officer I inquired about the advanced parole travel document, and the permission to
work document that we filed (with appropriate fees) and never received prior to the
interview. I was told that they were not necessary once my wife received her
green card. I asked about a refund of the fees, but was quickly told that there
would be no refund. I rebutted with the fact that I paid (a few hundred dollars) for
something that I did not receive, I didn't even receive expired paperwork. You
would have a hard time convincing me that this was anything less than fraud on
your part.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Daniel B. Pilts
